text.content:
NURSING NOTE 
    0700 - 1900

    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No
P: Alteration in comfort
I: Repositioning, ambulation
E: Current pain level is 2, goal is 0

MORSE FALL SCALE
 
   History of Falls   0 No
   Secondary Dx      15 Yes
   Ambulatory Aid     0 None/ Bedrest/ Nurse assist
   IV/Hep Lock       20 Yes
   Gait/Transfer      0 Normal/BR/Wheelchair
   Mental Status      0 Oriented to own ability

   TOTAL SCORE:      35

SKIN ASSESSMENT


PROBLEM LIST AND GOALS
   ANXIETY/COPING
      PROBLEM or Need:  COPING ENHANCEMENT
       Goal: 
       Target date: 
       Problem status:  NEW
      INTERVENTIONS
            Coping Enhancement (NIC 5230)
            Definition:  Assisting a patient to adapt to perceived stressors,
            changes, or threats that interfere with meeting life demands 
            and roles.
        ~ Provide factual INFORMATION concerning diagnosis, treatment,
          and prognosis.
        ~ Provide the patient with realistic CHOICES about certain aspects 
          of care.
        ~ Discourage decision-making when the patient is under severe stress.
        ~ Encourage the identification of specific LIFE VALUES.
        ~ Explore with the patient PREVIOUS METHODS of dealing with life 
          problems.
        ~ Encourage the patient to identify own STRENGTHS and ABILITIES.
        ~ Encourage VERBALIZATION of feelings, perceptions, and fears.
        ~ Assist the patient in identifying appropriate SHORT- and 
          LONG-TERM GOALS.
        ~ Encourage FAMILY involvement, as appropriate.
        EVALUATION: 

      Patient and/or Significant Other has had input and agreed to the 
      plan of care.
   ELIMINATION
   GENITOURINARY
   Problem or  Need: Urinary Elimination Management
   Target date:

   GOALS
   Urinary Elimination (NOC 0503)
   Definition:  Ability of the urinary system to filter 
   wastes,conserve solutes, and collect and  discharge urine.

      Indicators
      Elimination pattern within expected range
      24-hour intake and output balanced
      Urine passes without pain
      Urine passes without hesitancy
      Urine passes without urgency
      Urinary continence
      Empties bladder completely
      Laboratory values within normal limits (BUN, Creatinine, electrolytes,
      blood ketones, pH)


   Problem status:  NEW
   INTERVENTIONS
   Core competency: Urinary Elimination Management (NIC 0590) 
   Definition: Maintenance of an optimum urinary elimination pattern.
      Monitor urinary elimination including frequency, consistency, odor,
      volume, and color as appropriate.
   EVALUATION: 

   Outcomes
   Bowel Elimination (NOC 0501)
   Definition:  Ability of the gastrointestinal tract to 
   form and evacuate stool effectively.

      Control of bowel movements 
      Stool color within normal limits 
      Stool soft and formed 
      Constipation not present 
      Diarrhea not present 
      Comfort of stool passage 
      Bloating not present 
      Bowel sounds 
      Ingests adequate fluids 
      Ingests adequate fiber 
      Exercise is adequate amount 
IV ACCESS
   Peripheral IV 
     Size:20 g
     Location:R hand 
     Date placed:May 30,2012
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE

text.content:
First dose Unasyn IVPB given at approx 1700.

Report to oncoming RN at 1900.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE
